data.name: CouldNotElevatePrivilegesForUpdate
data.value: Could not elevate privileges necessary for update.

data.name: ErrorCheckingForUpdates
data.value: Cannot access the update server. The server might be down, or please make sure that TinyWall has been granted internet access, then try again.

data.name: UpdateAvailable
data.value: A newer version {0} of TinyWall is available. Do you want to update now?

data.name: NoUpdateAvailable
data.value: You have the newest version of TinyWall. No update necessary.

data.name: TinyWallIsCurrentlyLocked
data.value: TinyWall is current locked. Unlock and retry.

data.name: PleaseWaitWhileTinyWallChecksForUpdates
data.value: Please wait while TinyWall checks for available updates.

data.name: CouldNotCloseProcess
data.comment: Param0 is name, param1 is pid of process.

data.name: PasswordFieldsDoNotMatch
data.value: Password fields do not match. Please verify your input.

data.name: AreYouSureYouWantToRemoveAllExceptions
data.value: Are you sure you want to remove all firewall exceptions?

data.name: YouDoNotHaveAdministrativePrivilegesNeeded
data.value: You do not have administrative privileges needed to perform this operation. Select Elevate from the tray menu and try again.

data.name: ConfigurationHasBeenImported
data.value: The configuration file has been successfully imported. Press Apply in the Manage window to make the new settings permanent.

data.name: ConfigurationHasBeenExported
data.value: The configuration file has been successfully exported.

data.name: UpdateAvailableBubble
data.value: A newer version {0} of TinyWall is available. Click this bubble to start the update process.
data.comment: Param0 is version number of new version

data.name: TheFirewallIsNowOperatingAsRecommended
data.value: The firewall is now operating in the recommended mode.

data.name: TheFirewallIsNowAllowsOutgoingConnections
data.value: The firewall is now allowing outgoing connections but blocks incoming.

data.name: TheFirewallIsNowBlockingAllInAndOut
data.value: The firewall is now blocking all inbound and outbound traffic.

data.name: TheTinyWallServiceIsUnavailable
data.value: The TinyWall service is unavailable. Please make sure it is installed and started, then retry.

data.name: SettingHaveChangedRetry
data.value: The configuration has changed while you modified the preferences. To prevent losing settings, please make your changes again.

data.name: TheFirewallSettingsHaveBeenUpdated
data.value: The firewall settings have been successfully updated.

data.name: CommunicationWithTheServiceError
data.value: Communication with the TinyWall service encountered an error.

data.name: ClickOnAWindowWhitelisting
data.value: Click on the inner area of any open window to select its application for whitelisting.

data.name: CannotGetExecutablePathWhitelisting
data.value: Cannot get executable path. Whitelisting failed.

data.name: FirewallRulesForRecognizedChanged
data.value: Firewall rules for recognised {0} have been changed. Click this popup to edit the exception.

data.name: FirewallRulesForUnrecognizedChanged
data.value: Firewall rules for unrecognised {0} have been changed. Click this popup to edit the exception.

data.name: TinyWallHasBeenUnlocked
data.value: TinyWall has been unlocked. You may now issue commands that modify the configuration.

data.name: UnlockFailed
data.value: Unlock failed. Try again with another passphrase.

data.name: SearchingPath
data.comment: Param0 is a path which is being searched

data.name: RecognizedApplication
data.comment: Exception details window banner text. Param0 is name of application.

data.name: TheFirewallIsNowLearning
data.value: The firewall is now learning while letting all traffic through.

data.name: YouAreAboutToEnterLearningMode
data.value:
Are you sure you want to start automatic learning? In its automatic learning mode TinyWall will allow all traffic and remember which applications have used the network. When you exit learning mode, TinyWall will add exceptions for you automatically. Note however, that rules cannot be learned for "Special Exceptions" of the configuration.
Before entering learning mode, make sure that your system is free of any malware. It is best to run learning mode on freshly installed systems and it is recommended that you check your computer for viruses before using this mode.
Do you want to enter learning mode now?

data.name: DidYouInitiateTheUninstall
data.value: Did you initiate the uninstall/update of TinyWall?

data.name: PortListInvalid
data.value: The format of the port list is invalid. You can use one or more numbers in the range of 1-65535, separated by commas. An asterix (*) can also be used to refer to all possible ports.
data.comment: First line is dialogue main text. Rest are further information in smaller letters.

data.name: UnblockApp
data.value: Related files found The selected executable could be part of {0}. To ensure that this application can be used without limitations, it is recommended to also unblock some other files.
data.comment: First line is dialog main text. Rest are further information in smaller letters. Param0 is name of the app.

data.name: SelectedFileDoesNotExist
data.value: The specified file does not exist.

data.name: CompromisedApplication
data.comment: Exception details window banner text. Param0 is name of application.

data.name: CouldNotApplySettingsInternalError
data.value: Could not apply firewall settings due to an internal error.

data.name: Default
data.comment: As in, the standard, or default, if nothing else is set.

data.name: AllApplications
data.comment: Shown in settings for application exceptions that are global

data.name: Application
data.comment: Added due to issue of adding columns through the visual designer

data.name: RemoveSoftwareDialogueText
data.value: Select a software entry from the list!

data.name: Type
data.comment: Added due to issue of adding columns through the visual designer

data.name: HostEntryDuplicate
data.value: This IP/host is already in the list.

data.name: HostEntryInvalid
data.value: The IP/host entry is invalid. Enter an IPv4 address such as 192.168.1.10 or use CIDR notation like 10.0.0.0/24.

data.name: HostEntryInvalidPrefix
data.value: The CIDR prefix must be a number between 0 and 32.

data.name: HostEntryInvalidSubnetMask
data.value: The subnet mask is invalid. Provide a contiguous IPv4 subnet mask.

data.name: HostEntryPrompt
data.value: Enter an IPv4 address or CIDR block (for example 192.168.1.10 or 10.0.0.0/24). To use a subnet mask, enter it as 10.0.0.0/255.255.255.0.

data.name: HostEntryRequired
data.value: Specify an IPv4 address or CIDR block.

data.name: HostListRequired
data.value: Add at least one IP address or host before saving.
